DataElement.preferredName: Whole Body Diagnostic Imaging Computed Tomography Positron Emission Tomography Performed Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the date as related to computed tomography, a method of examining body organs by scanning them with X rays and using a computer to construct a series of cross-sectional scans along a single axis, or positron emission tomography, a technique for measuring the gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons (anti-electrons) within living tissue being performed as a method diagnostic evaluation.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Whole Body Diagnostic Imaging Computed Tomography Positron Emission Tomography Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to computed tomography, a method of examining body organs by scanning them with X rays and using a computer to construct a series of cross-sectional scans along a single axis, or positron emission tomography, a technique for measuring the gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons (anti-electrons) within living tissue being performed as a method diagnostic evaluation.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Whole; including all components without exception; being one unit or constituting the full amount or extent or duration; complete.:The entire physical structure of an organism.  It is composed of anatomic systems, regions, cavities, and spaces.:Any method that uses a visual display of structural or functional patterns of organs or tissues for diagnostic evaluation..

Concepts.definition: Including all components without exception; constituting the full amount or extent or duration; complete.
The entire physical structure of an organism. It is composed of anatomic systems, regions, cavities, and spaces.
Any method that uses a visual display of structural or functional patterns of organs or tissues for diagnostic evaluation.

Property.preferredName: Computed Tomography Positron Emission Tomography Performed
Property.preferredDefinition: A method of examining body organs by scanning them with X rays and using a computer to construct a series of cross-sectional scans along a single axis. :A technique for measuring the gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons (anti-electrons) within living tissue. In positron emission tomography (PET), a subject is given a dose of a positron-emitting radionuclide attached to a metabolically active substance (for example, 2-fluoro-2-deoxy-D-glucose (FDG), which is similar to a naturally occurring sugar, glucose, with the addition of a radioactive fluorine atom). When living tissue containing the positron emitter is bombarded by electrons, gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons is detected by a scanner, revealing in fine detail the tissue location of the metabolically-active substance administered.:Performed; carried out.

Concepts.definition: A method of examining structures within the body by scanning them with X rays and using a computer to construct a series of cross-sectional scans along a single axis.

A technique for measuring the gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons (anti-electrons) within living tissue. In positron emission tomography (PET), a subject is given a dose of a positron-emitting radionuclide attached to a metabolically active substance (for example, 2-fluoro-2-deoxy-D-glucose (FDG), which is similar to a naturally occurring sugar, glucose, with the addition of a radioactive fluorine atom). When living tissue containing the positron emitter is bombarded by electrons, gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons is detected by a scanner, revealing in fine detail the tissue location of the metabolically-active substance administered.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.origin: RTOG CRF:Radiation Therapy Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The date on which an observation was made or an event occurred.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.
